intro: Becium modestum, commonly known as the African orchid or the Cape orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Becium modestum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular in horticulture for its beauty and resilience.
